Entities.Name: Procedure
Entities.Definition: The specific surgical or medical procedure performed, recorded in the clinical notes.

Sample Data.Sentence: The spinal fusion procedure was performed using anterior instrumentation.

Entities.Name: Diagnosis
Entities.Definition: The medical condition diagnosed in the patient as described in the clinical notes.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient was diagnosed with lumbar spinal stenosis.

Entities.Name: IONM Technique
Entities.Definition: Technique used for intraoperative neuro-monitoring during surgeries, as noted in surgical records.

Sample Data.Sentence: IONM was conducted using somatosensory evoked potentials.
IONM results were stable throughout the procedure.

Entities.Name: Level
Entities.Definition: Refers to the specific vertebrae levels involved in spinal procedures.

Sample Data.Sentence: Procedure involved vertebrae from L2 to L4.

Entities.Name: Bone Graft
Entities.Definition: Type and details of bone graft used in the procedure.

Sample Data.Sentence: Autologous bone graft was harvested from the iliac crest.
Sample Data.Annotated: Bone Graft: autologous, from iliac crest

Sample Data.Sentence: Intraoperative fluoroscopy was utilized to verify proper placement of hardware.

Entities.Name: Navigation
Entities.Definition: The use of surgical navigation systems during the procedure.

Sample Data.Sentence: Navigational aids were used for screw placement accuracy.

Entities.Name: Fluid Amount
Entities.Definition: Amount of IV fluid used during the surgical procedure.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient received 500 mL of saline intravenously.

Entities.Name: Pelvic Fixation
Entities.Definition: Details regarding any pelvic fixation done during spinal surgeries.

Sample Data.Sentence: Pelvic fixation was performed using iliac screws.

Entities.Name: Complications
Entities.Definition: Any complications that occurred during the surgical procedure.

Dataset.Name: Clinical Notes from Orthopedics and Sports Medicine
Dataset.Details: Clinical notes dataset from the Orthopedics and Sports Medicine department, containing detailed annotations of procedures, diagnostics, and monitoring techniques.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Annotations were performed on clinical notes to identify specific medical procedures, diagnostic information, and intraoperative details. Guidelines include detailed definitions and examples for each entity to ensure accurate labeling by annotators.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: No direct link provided in the document for the annotation guidelines.
